text: Wonderful flavorsâ€¦ excellent food. The stuff chicken wings and basil chicken is wonderful. Tom yum soup is served in individual bowls. No basil pork or prawn cakes here.

Had a yummy meal here. The food is very refine and delicate. Very enjoyable. It wasnâ€™t overly flavoured, and it was very well balanced. Everything was yummy. Highly recommend to prebook your tables in advance. They are always full.

Been coming to this restaurant whenever I wanted spicy Tom Yam Kun . This time I took their experience menu and it was good and value for your wallet . The mango salad is good and pineapple rice is nice too . Remember to order the stuff chicken donâ€™t missed it .

Set menu is very recommended
This time we ordered set for 8pax, cost around 600++, CP value is high.
Their business is quite good, even on the weekdays, it's about 80% full.
Service is very responsive and friendly. Definitely will come back here again soon.

Summary: taste ok, serving super small, service ok, price too ex.

generally, no complaint on the food in terms of taste, except that the price for the serving that you are getting and the quality theyâ€™re getting doesnâ€™t seem like it is very worth it. Moreover, there is nothing special about the service. It is decent no complaints, but also not outstanding given that they are pricing of food at this value, there is somewhat an expectation for the presentation or the service or just simply the feeling that youâ€™re getting your bucks worth.

The soup was pathetically small given that it was 14 bucks. I only order 2 bowls cos I thought we could just share it. But $33.5 (w/ GST) of soup was barely for 1 person serving. They gave me extra utensils but I couldn't bring myself to share. The spoons felt too big for the bowl ðŸ˜‚.

Fish was a good size for 3 pax , whether it's worth $155.9  (w/ GST)... You decide.

I didn't even bother to take photo of the kailan, it was decent but not worth 18 bucks.

3 dishes inclusive of a fish was a whopping 220 bucks.
